basic_info.name: MG Windsor EV
basic_info.description: MG Windsor EV is a 5-seater electric MUV available at a starting price of Rs. 14 Lakh. The electric car is available in 5 variants.Additionally, Windsor EV offers a Ground Clearance measurement of 186 mm and a Boot capacity of 604 liters. You can choose from 4 colors for the Windsor EV. The battery range/mileage of the Windsor EV is 449 Km/Full Charge.

Introduction: The MG Windsor EV is a modern electric car designed for daily use without the hassle of visiting a fuel pump.
It not only carries people comfortably but also has plenty of storage and stowage space.
A unique feature of the Windsor EV is that it has a V2L (Vehicle-To-Load) charging capability.
The Windsor’s lithium-ion battery gives it an impressive range on a single charge.
Not only is the journey with the Windsor safe, but it’s relaxing and entertaining as well.
Exterior: Unlike an open grille in traditional cars, the Windsor gets a clean, mostly closed panel.
This is so because electric cars do not require much air for cooling.
A light-up MG logo sits in the middle of the nose, and just above or around it runs a wide strip of LED lighting.
The strip stretches across the car, forming a continuous ‘light bar’ for DRLs.
Its main headlights are bigger LED units placed lower down in the front bumper.
This positioning gives the EV a two-layered face, a slim light strip on top, and chunkier lamps below.
From the side, the roofline gently curves from front to rear without any sudden drops.
This gives it a capsule like appearance as the panels are free of heavy creases as well.
The Windsor EV’s door handles sit flush with the body for better aerodynamics and pop out when needed.
It comes with large 18‑inch alloy wheels that have a more “closed” design.
Framed by subtly flared wheel arches and dark plastic cladding around the lower edges, protects the body from scrapes.
The rear is also very rounded, with a softly curved tailgate and bumper rather than an upright, boxy back.
A single, connected LED light bar runs across the width of the car for the tail lamps, giving it a modern look when lit,
The individual lamp clusters themselves are relatively compact.
Its badging is kept simple, as we mainly see the MG logo, the Windsor name, and a neat rear bumper with reflectors.
Interior: The Windsor’s ‘Aero-Lounge’ seats are nicely padded and can recline up to 135 degrees, making long rides more relaxing.
It has a spacious cabin with dual-tone ivory interiors and premium soft-touch materials with classy gold highlights.
A digital 8.8-inch driver display and a massive 15.6-inch infotainment screen provides all information including battery charge status and range.
Its panoramic glass roof adds to the airy and open feel inside the cabin, letting in natural light.
The front seats are ventilated and the occupants stay cool and comfy even on hot days.
An ambient lighting inside comes with 256 colour options to set it as per a user’s taste.
Its steering wheel is leather-wrapped with controls for easy access to music and calls.
The rear seats also recline nicely, offering extra comfort for passengers and plenty of legroom.
This EV has practical features like wireless phone charging, a large glovebox, and storage compartments.
For convenience, there’s automatic climate control and rear AC vents to keep everyone comfortable.
A premium nine-speaker Infinity audio system delivers rich sound for music enthusiasts.
The interior controls are easy to use, with some physical buttons mainly for AC and steering controls.
Additional features include a 360-degree camera, smart entry, and a V2L charging feature, which powers other electronic appliances.
It includes safety touches like six airbags, auto-dimming rearview mirror, and even ADAS in the Pro variants.
Powertrain: A Permanent Magnet Synchronous Motorthat powers the Windsor EV is quite efficient and smooth.
It a power output of 135.8bhp and 200Nm of torque.
The Windsor EV is offered in two battery capacities - a 38kWh and a bigger 52.9kWh.
Charging the battery can be done at home with traditional 15A chargers or even through higher capacity public DC units.
The bigger battery takes about 9.5 hours to fully charge on a regular charger and just 50 minutes on a fast charger.
